snippet: The minority Rohingya Muslims have been leaving Myanmar in droves since clashes with ethnic Rakhine Buddhists, who make up a majority of the state’s population, erupted in June and October 2012
abstract: About 50 members of Muslim minority in Myanmar are feared drowned after trying to flee Rakhine State in a boat that sank; minority Rohingya Muslims have been leaving country in droves since clashes with ethnic Rakhine Buddhists, who make up a majority of the state's population, erupted in 2012.
lead_paragraph: The minority Rohingya Muslims have been leaving Myanmar in droves since clashes with ethnic Rakhine Buddhists, who make up a majority of the state’s population, erupted in June and October 2012

headline.main: Boat Sinks as Muslims Try to Flee Myanmar; 50 Are Feared Dead
headline.print_headline: Boat Sinks as Muslims Try to Flee Myanmar; 50 Are Feared Dead
